permissions.name: Manage Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to manage the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

params.name: description
params.doc: Description to explain the reason for the points adjustment.

params.name: revision
params.doc:
Each time the loyalty account is updated, `revision` increments by 1.

The current `revision` must be passed when adjusting points in the loyalty account. This 
ensures you're working with the latest version of the loyalty account and prevents unintended overwrites.

docs.summary:
Adjusts the point balance of a loyalty account.

You can adjust the balance in two ways:
- `balance` allows you to set the total points balance to this new amount.
- `amount` allows you to adjust the points balance by this amount. This amount can be a positive number to increase the points balance or a negative number to decrease the balance.

examples.title: Adjust account balance
body:
curl -X POST \
  'https://www.wixapis.com/loyalty-accounts/v1/accounts/e6f39a5b-a6d0-4556-b889-0cf09d8a84f7/adjust-points' \
  -H 'Authorization: <AUTH>' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data-raw '{
        "accountId": "01e34b81-4e48-43e4-b178-c84f3b968574",
        "description": "Sync from external program",
        "balance": 15,
        "revision": "3"
  }'

permissions.name: Manage Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to manage the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

params.name: contactId
params.doc:
Contact ID for a Wix site contact. See the Contacts API to 
[learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object).

docs.summary:
Creates a loyalty account for one of a site's contacts.

To create a new loyalty account, the customer must first be a site contact with a contact ID. See the Contacts API to 
[learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object). The site must also 
have an active loyalty program before loyalty accounts can be created. See the activate loyalty program endpoint 
[to activate a site's loyalty program](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty/program/activate-loyalty-program).

examples.title: Create an account for the contact

permissions.name: Manage Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to manage the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

params.name: amount
params.doc:
Amount of points to earn. Must be a positive, whole number.

Min: `1`

Max: `9,999,999`

params.name: description
params.doc:
Description of how the points were earned.

Max: 100 characters

params.name: appId
params.doc:
ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

If points were earned manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceUniqueId`.

params.name: idempotencyKey
params.doc: Unique string identifier generated by the app. Wix uses this identifier to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

docs.summary:
Adds points to a loyalty account.

Only a positive amount can be added using the earn points endpoint.

examples.title: Add points to account
body:
curl -X POST \
  'https://www.wixapis.com/loyalty-accounts/v1/accounts/e6f39a5b-a6d0-4556-b889-0cf09d8a84f7/earn-points' \
  -H 'Authorization: <AUTH>' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data-raw '{
          "accountId": "e6f39a5b-a6d0-4556-b889-0cf09d8a84f7",
          "amount": 10,
          "description": "For subscribing to the newsletter",
          "appId": "db9c3016-ff93-4105-bdef-ff852f3c74c0",
          "idempotencyKey": "baa05589-20d1-45db-ba29-99920bccf37e"
  }'

permissions.name: Read Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the account to retrieve.

docs.summary:
Retrieves an account using the loyalty account ID.

You can also retrieve an account using a secondary ID, such as a contact ID or a member ID by using 
the [Get Account by Secondary Id endpoint](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty/accounts/get-account-by-secondary-id).

permissions.name: Read Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

docs.summary:
Retrieves the account belonging to the specified contact or member.

This endpoint retrieves loyalty accounts using the customer's contact ID or member ID. Your app can also retrieve an account
using the loyalty account ID by using the [Get Account endpoint](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty/accounts/get-account-by-secondary-id).

examples.title: Get account by contactId or memberId

permissions.name: Read Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

docs.summary:
Retrieves the total amount of points earned, redeemed, and adjusted for the entire loyalty program.

The `balance` is the current total of points outstanding, while the `earned`, `adjusted`, and `redeemed` amounts 
are the historically accumulated amounts. The totals include the amounts for all loyalty accounts.

permissions.name: Read Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a transaction using the transaction ID.

Loyalty transactions include activity that changes a loyalty account point balance, such as adjusting, earning, or redeeming loyalty points. 
If you want to [retrieve all of the transactions for a specific loyalty account](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty/accounts/list-transactions), use the List Transactions endpoint.

permissions.name: Read Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

params.name: contactIds
params.doc: List of contact IDs. See the Contacts API to [learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object).

params.name: cursorPaging.cursor
params.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of accounts, given the provided filters.

examples.title: Get a list of accounts, given the provided filters
Get a list of accounts, given the provided filters

permissions.name: Read Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

params.name: cursorPaging.cursor
params.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of transactions, given the provided filters.

Loyalty transactions include activity that changes a loyalty account point balance, such as adjusting, earning, or redeeming loyalty points. 
If you want to [retrieve a specific transaction using that transaction's ID](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty/accounts/get-transaction), use the Get Transaction endpoint.

examples.title: Get a list of transactions
response:
{"transactions": [
    {
    "id": "03992fc4-8e8c-4406-8d3c-0292ed3be5d8",

  },
    {

messages.name: _com_wixpress_loyalty_account_LoyaltyAccountEntityUpdatedEvent
messages.displayName: Loyalty Account Entity Updated Event Object

members.name: currentEntity
members.doc: Event body

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: fields
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: kind
members.doc: The kind of value.

members.name: nullValue
members.doc: Represents a null value.

members.name: numberValue
members.doc: Represents a double value.

members.name: stringValue
members.doc: Represents a string value.

members.name: boolValue
members.doc: Represents a boolean value.

members.name: structValue
members.doc: Represents a structured value.

members.name: listValue
members.doc: Represents a repeated `Value`.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
 This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
 We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
 Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dipatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
 This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
 Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
 Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dipatching

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
 For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
 NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

docs.summary:
A loyalty account stores a customer's loyalty points balance. A site's customers can earn points to their account
and redeem those points for rewards.

members.name: id
members.doc: Account ID.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Account owner's contact ID. See the Contacts API to [learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object).

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Account owner's member ID. See the Members API to [learn more about a site's members](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members/member-object).

members.name: points
members.doc: Information about the account totals.

members.name: latestTransaction
members.doc: Details of the account's latest transaction.

members.name: rewardAvailable
members.doc: Whether the account has an available reward.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the account was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the account was last updated.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Each time the loyalty account is updated, `revision` increments by 1.

The current `revision` must be passed when updating the loyalty account. This ensures you're 
working with the latest version of the loyalty account and prevents unintended overwrites.

Ignored when creating an account.

members.name: balance
members.doc:
Current point balance.

Equal to the sum of `earned` and `adjusted` points, minus `redeemed` points.

members.name: earned
members.doc: Total earned points.

members.name: adjusted
members.doc: Total adjusted points.

members.name: redeemed
members.doc: Total redeemed points.

members.name: id
members.doc: Transaction ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Amount of earned, adjusted, or redeemed points in the latest transaction.

members.name: type
members.doc: Transaction type.

members.name: description
members.doc: Description of the latest transaction.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the transaction was created.

members.name: rewardId
members.doc:
__Deprecated.__ For `latestTransaction.rewardId`, use `latestTransaction.redeemInfo.rewardId` instead. This property 
will be removed on June 30, 2022.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

Only present if `type` is `EARN` or `ADJUST`.

If points were earned or adjusted manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned or adjusted in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceUniqueId`.

members.name: idempotencyKey
members.doc:
Unique string identifier generated by the app. Wix uses this identifier to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

Only present if points were added manually using the [Earn Points endpoint](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty/program/earn-points).

members.name: redeemInfo
members.doc: Additional redeem information. Only present if `type` is `REDEEM`.

members.name: id
members.doc: Transaction ID.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Account owner's contact ID. See the Contacts API to [learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object).

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Account owner's member ID. See the Members API to [learn more about a site's members](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members/member-object).

members.name: amount
members.doc: Points earned, adjusted, or redeemed in the latest transaction.

members.name: description
members.doc: Transaction description. Only present for automated transactions of `type` `EARN` or `REDEEM`, when set by the site owner in the Business Manager.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time of the transaction.

members.name: rewardId
members.doc:
__Deprecated.__ For `transaction.rewardId`, use `transaction.redeemInfo.rewardId` instead. This property 
will be removed on June 30, 2022.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

Only present if `type` is `EARN` or `ADJUST`.

If points were earned or adjusted manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned or adjusted in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceUniqueId`.

members.name: idempotencyKey
members.doc:
Unique string identifier generated by the app. Wix uses this identifier to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

Only present if points were added manually using the [Earn Points endpoint](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty/program/earn-points).

members.name: redeemInfo
members.doc: Additional redeem information. Only present if `type` is `REDEEM`.

members.name: rewardId
members.doc: Reward ID.

members.name: rewardType
members.doc: Type of reward that was redeemed.

members.name: account
members.doc: Updated account.

members.name: sourceAccounts
members.doc: Source accounts.

members.name: updatedAccount
members.doc: Merged account.

members.name: contactId
members.doc:
Contact ID for a Wix site contact. See the Contacts API to 
[learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object).

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of the account to retrieve.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load. Minimum `1`, maximum `50`.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: accounts
members.doc: Loyalty accounts.

messages.displayName: Get Account By Secondary Id Response Object

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: contactIds
members.doc: List of contact IDs. See the Contacts API to [learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object).

members.name: accounts
members.doc: Loyalty accounts.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc:
Amount of points to earn. Must be a positive, whole number.

Min: `1`

Max: `9,999,999`

members.name: description
members.doc:
Description of how the points were earned.

Max: 100 characters

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

If points were earned manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceUniqueId`.

members.name: idempotencyKey
members.doc: Unique string identifier generated by the app. Wix uses this identifier to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: description
members.doc: Description to explain the reason for the points adjustment.

members.name: type
members.doc: Type of the `Adjust Points` call.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Each time the loyalty account is updated, `revision` increments by 1.

The current `revision` must be passed when adjusting points in the loyalty account. This 
ensures you're working with the latest version of the loyalty account and prevents unintended overwrites.

members.name: balance
members.doc:
Sets the account's point balance to this amount. Must be a positive, whole number.

The net difference between this new balance and the previous balance will be reflected in the `adjusted` field of the customer's account.

Max: `999,999,999`

members.name: amount
members.doc:
Adjusts the account's point balance by this amount. Must be a whole number with a maximum of 7 digits. 
The amount can be negative, but cannot be `0`.

Min: `-9,999,999`

Max: `9,999,999`

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: rewardId
members.doc: Reward ID. See [Rewards API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/loyalty/rewards/rewards-object) for more details.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of times the given reward will be redeemed. Must be a positive whole number.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time points are redeemed.
To prevent conflicting changes, the existing `revision` must be used when redeeming points.

members.name: referenceEntityId
members.doc: Id of the entity that is being redeemed (e.g. orderId for order discount, couponId for coupon reward).

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: id
members.doc: Transaction ID.

members.name: transaction
members.doc: Retrieved transaction.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc:
TODO: This is not implemented and we can implement it later

members.name: transactions

docs.summary:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • EARN
  • REDEEM
  • ADJUST
